case_title: United States of America v. Keith
case_info_full_case_name: United States of America v. Keith

charges.charge_description: 18:922G.F UNLAWFUL TRANSPORT OF FIREARMS, ETC. (possession of firearm by convicted felon)(1)

charges.charge_disposition: Imprisonment: 115 Months to run concurrent with the state sentence imposed in Case No. 02-665CF imposed on 11/15/04; Court recommends the deft receive substance abuse therapy while incarcerated and that the BOP take into account the special needs of deft raised in Dr. Danzinger's letter to be submitted to the BOP along with copy of the PSR. Supervised release: 2 years; Mandatory drug testing requirements are imposed. Special conditions of supervised release: Participate in a program for treatment of drug/alcohol dependency and mental health treatment and contribute to the costs of these programs; Submit to a search of person, residence, place of business, etc.; Cooperate in the collection of DNA. Special Assessment: $100.00; Fine: Waived; Forfeiture: Ruger Model P89, 9mm caliber and 8 rounds of ammunition. Defendant remanded
